channel.title: Pork on Cooking
channel.description: Recent content in Pork on Cooking

item.title: Pork Chops
item.description: Cooking pork chops and finished in bacon grease in cast iron Used the Joule to cook fresh bone-on pork chops at at 140 degrees for 1 hour. While that was cooking I cooked 8 strips of bacon in a cast iron skillet. After the pork chops were done I browned the pork chops in the left over bacon grease. Why not?

item.title: Ribs
item.description: Ribs 3-2-1 Method Came out tender, but not fall off the bone. Basically, followed various sites and books; there isn’t a lot to the basic process. Removed the membrane and used a rib rub. Place ribs in smoker at 225 degrees F for three hours. Wrap ribs tightly in foil and smoke for 2 hours. Take foil off and return to smoker bone side down for 1 hour. Apply sauce to ribs during the last 30 minutes of cooking time.
